titlestmt.titleproper: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of the Executive Director records 1953-2003
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Office of the Executive Director records

bioghist.p: The College of Physicians of Philadelphia, founded in 1787, is the oldest professional medical organization in the country. The College is home to the MÃ¼tter Museum and the Historical Medical Library. Through its program of lectures, workshops, and conferences, as well as through the C. Everett Koop Community Education Center and PhillyHealthInfo.org, an online health information resource, the College provides a place for both medical professionals and the general public to learn about medicine as both a science and as an art. Past Executive Directors of the College include Marc Micozzi and John O'Donnell.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the Office of the Executive Director. The materials in the collection date from 1953 to 2003 and include records of John M. O'Donnell, William F. Chaveas, and Marc Micozzi. Materials include correspondence and memoranda; minutes and agendas for meetings of the Council and of various College committees; subject files; appointment books; financial records; development and strategic planning files; information on Fellows, including statistical reports; fellowship ballots and proxies; files on College programs, lectures, and events, including programs, announcements, and photographs of speakers; records related to facilities and maintenance matters and building renovations; files on and external projects and medical organizations, such as the History of Nursing in Philadelphia project, Philadelphia Health Management Corporation, the Health Sciences Library Consortium, the Association of American Medical Colleges, the National Library of Medicine, and the Royal Society of Medicine.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
